Remove and Analyze Outliers

Source: R/PomaOutliers.R
PomaOutliers.Rd

This function allows users to analyze outliers by different plots and remove them from an MSnSet object.

PomaOutliers(
  data,
  do = "clean",
  method = "euclidean",
  type = "median",
  coef = 1.5,
  labels = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

A MSnSet object. First pData column must be the subject group/type.
do

Action to do. Options are "clean" (to remove detected outliers) and "analyze" (to analyze data outliers). Note that the output of this function will be different depending on this parameter.
method

Distance measure method to perform MDS. Options are "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra" and "minkowski". See ?dist().
type

Type of outliers analysis to perform. Options are "median" (default) and "centroid". See vegan::betadisper.
coef

This value corresponds to the classical 1.5 in \(Q3 + 1.5*IQR\) formula to detect outliers. By changing this value, the permissiveness in outlier detection will change.
labels

Logical indicating if sample IDs should to be plotted or not.

Value

A MSnSet object with cleaned data or different exploratory plots for the detailed analysis of outliers (depending on "do" parameter).

Author

Pol Castellano-Escuder

Examples

data("st000336")

# clean outliers
st000336 %>% 
  PomaImpute() %>%
  PomaNorm() %>%
  PomaOutliers()

#> method argument is empty! KNN will be used
#> method argument is empty! log_pareto will be used
#> MSnSet (storageMode: lockedEnvironment)
#> assayData: 30 features, 50 samples 
#>   element names: exprs 
#> protocolData: none
#> phenoData
#>   sampleNames: DMD004.1.U02 DMD005.1.U02 ... DMD173.1.U02 (50 total)
#>   varLabels: group steroids
#>   varMetadata: labelDescription
#> featureData: none
#> experimentData: use 'experimentData(object)'
#> Annotation:  
#> - - - Processing information - - -
#> Imputed (knn): Fri Apr 16 18:08:47 2021 
#> Normalized (log_pareto): Fri Apr 16 18:08:47 2021 
#> Outliers removed (euclidean and median): Fri Apr 16 18:08:47 2021 
#>  MSnbase version: 2.16.1 

# analyze outliers
st000336 %>% 
  PomaImpute() %>%
  PomaNorm() %>%
  PomaOutliers(do = "analyze")

#> method argument is empty! KNN will be used
#> method argument is empty! log_pareto will be used
#> $polygon_plot
#> 
#> $distance_boxplot
#> 
#> $outliers
#>          sample    group distance_to_centroid limit_distance
#> 1  DMD119.2.U02 Controls             2.742576       2.290945
#> 2 DMD084.11.U02      DMD             4.522825       4.040548
#> 3 DMD087.12.U02      DMD             4.252170       4.040548
#> 4 DMD023.10.U02      DMD             5.653399       4.040548
#> 5 DMD046.11.U02      DMD             5.580959       4.040548
#> 6  DMD133.9.U02      DMD             5.349670       4.040548
#> 7 DMD135.10.U02      DMD             4.055233       4.040548
#>
